metadata.description: Choose a name for the Logic App. If you are only monitoring a single resource group, it is recommended to append the name with your resource group name (e.g., ANFCapacityManager_myrg.rg).
The location/region where the Logic App will be deployed. Leave as is to deploy to the same region as the containing resource group.
The resource group where you would like the Alert Rules to be created. The Logic App will need a 'contributor' role to this resource group.
Leave blank to monitor your entire subscription (recommended). Alternatively, you can specify a single resource group to monitor for new Azure NetApp Files resources.
This is the percent consumed threshold that will trigger an alert for all Azure NetApp Files Capacity Pools. A whole number between 1 and 100 is required.
This is the percent consumed threshold that will trigger an alert for all Azure NetApp Files Volumes. A whole number between 1 and 100 is required.
The resource group that contains your existing Action Group. This Action Group will be triggered when a Capacity Pool or Volume reaches the specified percent full threshold.
The name of your existing Action Group. This Action Group will be triggered when a Capacity Pool or Volume reaches the specified percent full threshold.

This is the percent (of the existing volume size) to automatically grow a volume if it reaches the percent full threshold specified above. A value of 0 (zero) will disable the AutoGrow functionality. To enable, a value between 10 and 100 is required.

variables.name: action_group
variables.value: [parameters('Existing Action Group Name for Capacity Notifications')]

runError.message: Unexpected action type received. Expected 'write' or 'delete'.
Unexpected action type received. Expected 'write' or 'delete'.
Unexpected alert type. This workflow should be triggered only when an Azure NetApp Files resource is created, modified, or deleted.
